name: Welsh Rarebit
description: A savory dish made from a deliciously rich cheese sauce, typically served hot over toasted bread. This classic Welsh dish is often enhanced with beer, mustard, and Worcestershire sauce for added flavor.
steps: In a saucepan, melt butter and stir in the flour to make a roux.
Gradually add beer to the roux while continuously stirring to create a smooth sauce.
Add grated cheese to the saucepan, stirring until the cheese is melted.
Season the cheese sauce with mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Pour the hot cheese sauce over slices of toasted bread.
Grill the topped bread under a broiler until bubbly and golden brown.
ingredients: 1/2 cup beer, preferably a stout or ale
tips: For a non-alcoholic version, substitute beer with milk.
Experiment with different types of cheese for variety.
Adding a small amount of paprika can give the dish a nice color and a bit of heat.
